docs.lead_paragraph: One big question about President Obama's bipartisan health care summit, scheduled for Feb. 25, is whether American voters will really get a full and open competition of ideas and emerge with a clearer sense of whether they support or oppose the various proposals put forward by Republicans and Democrats.

headline.main: Risks, and Perhaps Rewards, in Obama's Health Summit

docs.abstract: The president's proposed summit raises expectations, and questions, in Washington.
docs.snippet: The president's proposed summit raises expectations, and questions, in Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress will get off to a slow start this week because of the weather, but Democrats are hoping to make quick progress on a job-creating measure before taking a President's Day recess.
docs.abstract: Action on Capitol Hill will be a bit delayed this week, in the aftermath of the blizzard that gripped Washington.
docs.snippet: Action on Capitol Hill will be a bit delayed this week, in the aftermath of the blizzard that gripped Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: The meeting would mark the first time in the long health care debate that leaders from both sides would be allowed to air their ideas publicly.

headline.main: Obama Plans Bipartisan Summit on Health Care
headline.print_headline: President Plans A Joint Summit On Health Care

docs.snippet: The meeting would mark the first time in the long health care debate that leaders from both sides would be allowed to air their ideas publicly.

docs.lead_paragraph: The response to a proposed commission to work on reducing the deficit demonstrates the bipartisan lack of will to deal with a chronic and potentially disastrous spending gap.

headline.main: Heads in Sand Over Long-Term U.S. Budget Fixes
headline.print_headline: Heads in Sand Over Long-Term U.S. Budget Fixes

docs.snippet: The response to a proposed commission to work on reducing the deficit demonstrates the bipartisan lack of will to deal with a chronic and potentially disastrous spending gap.
